bibl.title: Letter from [Charles] E. Otis to Howard A. Kelly, July 10, 1907

div1.p: Otis sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from [Charles] E. Otis to Howard A. Kelly, July 10, 1907
div1.opener:
C. E. & J. C. OTIS,
ATTORNEYS AT LAW
GLOBE BUILDING
ST. PAUL, MINNESOTA.
July 10th., 1907
Ans
Mr. Howard A. Kelly
1418 Eutaw Place,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Sir:-
div1.p:
Enclosed find New York draft for $5.00 to your order for the
benefit of John R. Kissinger, mention of whose great service to
humanity is made in the recent number of the Outlook. Humanity owns him
a debt it can never repay. I only fear that what is everybody's
business will result in nobody's business.
div1.closer: Yours sincerely, Chas. E. Otis- C.E.O.
